snippet.title: Derelict (PC 2008) - Full Game 1080p60 HD Walkthrough - No Commentary
snippet.description:
Contains the full game: all 20 levels without commentary, recorded with Elgato HD60.

If you enjoyed watching this video, please leave a like and subscribe! I would very much appreciate it!

I really loved this game. Sure it has its ups and downs, and can be very hard and confusing at times, but overall the game has a great concept! 
I believe this is the first Derelict walkthrough on YouTube!

Free to download on MyAbandonware: https://www.myabandonware.com/game/derelict-ckx

Derelict (PC) playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYwqV0N4djf8tZZP0SN2_MFh5gp5ITh7G

Summary: 

In the year 2284, after many years of a war between the Terran forces and the forces of former Earth colony Mendel, the United Terran Forces have plans to invade Mendel and has chosen the previously uncolonized world Epsilon Eridani F to be their staging base. The super Battlecruiser Atlas was sent to the region to construct spaceport facilities, but was seized by a deadly weapon. The marines have been called back to save the ship, but the infection is becoming more entrenched. The final dropship has been sent, carrying a group of 5 battle hardened space marines.

Derelict is a first person shooter and a tactical action game inspired by Space Hulk: Vengeance of the Blood Angels. The player controls a group of 5 space marines in two ways: directly in first person view (with the keyboard and mouse) or by giving them orders via map view (primarily with the mouse). Each marine has its own skills and abilities:
- Communications: the communications specialist can see enemies in the map screen.
- Heavy Assault: carries a belt fed Gatlin Cannon which doesn't need to be reloaded.
- Demolition: the demolition expert carries a modified rifle with a grenade launcher attached, which power can rip apart obstacles and temporarily disrupt teleportation systems.
- Engineer: carries automated tools to repair doors and can hack security system faster than the other marines.
- Medic: can heal the other team members and has a hazard suit which allows him to walk through dangerous areas.

The player can switch among the marines any time by pressing the proper hot keys or using the mouse wheel. While controlling a marine, the others will be AI controlled.

The game has a total of 20 levels and five difficulty ranks, from private to general, and the harder the rank, the more frequently enemies respawn, the quicker they move and the slower the medic heals.

Release Date: July 6, 2008
Genre: Survival Horror, First-Peron Shooter, Strategy
Platforms: Windows

--Development Team--
Concept:
Erik Hogan

Design:
Erik Hogan

Programming:
Erik Hogan

Additional Level Design:
Sam Jeffreys, Miika Vihersaari

Sound Design:
Kristie Addison

Additional Music:
Samuel Gavin, Edward Clombe, Bill Norris, Krystian Krewniak

3D Models:
Mark Harper (for 3D Gun Models), Craig Nisbet (for misc furniture objects), The Game Creators for 3D Animated Characters, Geometrics for Space Ship

Cast:
Sam Jeffreys (Communications), Jonathan McCarthy (Assault), Steve Godrich (Demolitions), Sam Jeffreys (Engineer's voice), Luchian Deurell (Engineer's face), Guilherme Chirinéa (Medic), Erik Hogan (???)

Playtesters:
Christian Miniscalco, Jacob Canull, Matt Griffith, Matthew Gatland
------------------
My Xbox gamertag: Shad0wx54x
My PlayStation gamertag: ToughGamingGuyYT

Wanna see more of my fantastic walkthroughs? Give it a go: https://www.youtube.com/user/ToughGamingGuy/playlists
